Articles.Content: I have Kerbal Space Program 1.9.1 installed.  When I try to apply the patch to go to 1.10.1, the installer fails with a "Please select a valid Kerbal Space Program folder" popup.  What defines a "valid Kerbal Space Program folder"?

On Windows, your "Kerbal Space Program" folder that usually is in your main (C:) drive.

Also, I wouldn't recommend using the patchers, they hardly ever work for me.

Edited July 30, 2020 by Entropian
eeenglish
For CKAN at least it's the file buildID64.txt that defines a valid KSP installation.
